DataElement.preferredName: Patient Laboratory Procedure Outcome Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to the results of lab tests.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Laboratory Procedure Outcome Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The result of an action._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:The result of an action.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/15/18 tt released. 1/31/18 tt edit/ change to question text. 12/15/17 tt/EAE161.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have adequat
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have adequate bone marrow, coagulation, renal and hepatic function, including eGFR calculation greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 (within 28 days of screening CT submission)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 01
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of transplant associated-thrombotic microangiopathy (TA-TMA), was a creatinine clearance or radioisotope GFR performed for renal function assessment and was the creatinine clearance of radioisotope GFR greater than or equal to 70 ml/min/1.73 m2?

DataElement.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElement.changeDescription: 11/15/18 tt released. 1/31/18 tt edits/changes to question text. 12/15/17 tt/EAE161.
